document_data.name: Halavan Nuts
document_data.location: Eastern [[Calimshan]], south of [[Amn]], borders of the [[Shaar]], [[Tashalar]], east [[Faerûn]]
document_data.distinctions: Thorny bushes; fruit like large cashews
document_data.mainbody:
'''Halavan nuts''' were a staple food nut across [[Faerûn]].
{{quote|I value these nuts highly, one might even say they are precious to me. Conduct thy depredations accordingly.|The sage [[Tabarast]] in 761 DR to his comrade Beldrune}}
document_data.Description: The bush itself was low and thorny; the nut looked like a large [[cashew]], but tasted more like a [[pistachio]].
document_data.Availability: They grew wherever conditions were hilly, rocky and windswept. This included also eastern [[Calimshan]], south of [[Amn]], and the edges of the [[Shaar]]. The nuts were a staple food in the [[Tashalar]] and they were eaten across the rural areas of eastern [[Faerûn]].
document_data.Usage: They were eaten roasted or raw.
document_data.History: [[Tabarast]], a sage, had a jar of nuts while he studied at [[Moonshorn Tower]] in the {{yearlinkName|761}}. He shared some with [[Beldrune]], a fellow sage.
